revision.text:
{{Infobox person | image = Ike Barinholtz at PaleyFest 2013.jpg | caption = Barinholtz at PaleyFest 2013's panel for ''[[The Mindy Project]]'' | birthname = Isaac Barinholtz | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|2|18}} | birth_place = [[Rogers Park, Chicago]], [[Illinois]], U.S. | occupation = Comedian, actor, screenwriter | years_active = 2001–present | spouse = Erica Hanson | children = 3 | Siblings = Jon Barinholtz }} '''Isaac "Ike" Barinholtz''' (born February 18, 1977) is an American comedian, actor and screenwriter. He was a cast member on ''[[MADtv]]'' from 2002 to 2007, ''[[Eastbound & Down]]'' (2012), and had a regular role on ''[[The Mindy Project]]''. In his film work, he is best known for his acting roles in ''[[Neighbors (2014 film)|Neighbors]]'' (2014) and its sequel, ''[[Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising]]'' (2016), ''[[Sisters (2015 film)|Sisters]]'' (2015), ''[[Suicide Squad (film)|Suicide Squad]]'' (2016) and ''[[Blockers (film)|Blockers]]'' (2018), as well for as co-writing the screenplay for the 2016 comedy film ''[[Central Intelligence]]''. ==Early life and education== Barinholtz was born in the [[Rogers Park, Chicago|Rogers Park]] area of [[Chicago, Illinois]], and was raised in its [[Lake View, Chicago|Lake View]] neighborhood,{{cite news|last=Metz|first=Nina|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/ct-ent-0912-fall-preview-tv-profile-20120911,0,4096500.story|title=Dork and Mindy: Chicagoan Ike Barinholtz ready to throw his weight around on new project|date=2012-09-11|publisher=chicagotribune.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} the son of Peggy and Alan Barinholtz, an attorney.{{cite news|last=Sullivan|first=Catey|url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=PGHB&p_multi=SKYB&p_theme=pghb&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=118DF2518B7E4E78&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM|title= Funny sons of funny fathers|date=2007-04-25|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|accessdate=2013-02-10}} Barinholtz has described his parents as "liberal people with great senses of humor," and has said that he was raised in a "very funny home."{{cite news|last=Isackson|first=Noah|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2004-04-04/features/0404040303_1_funny-people-chicago-improv-festival-sports-bloopers|title=Ike Barinholtz - Mad About Tv Comedy|date=2004-04-04|publisher=chicagotribune.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} Barinholtz is [[Jewish]],{{cite web|last=Radloff |first=Jessica |url=http://www.glamour.com/entertainment/blogs/obsessed/2014/09/ike-barinholtz-mindy-project |title=Ike Barinholtz From The Mindy Project Talks Chris Messina, Mindy Kaling, and Marriage |publisher=Glamour |date= |accessdate=2016-05-23}} and attended [[Bernard Zell Anshe Emet Day School]], before attending [[The Latin School of Chicago]] for high school. He had planned on becoming a politician, but decided to move to [[Los Angeles, California]], to be an actor instead. He worked at a telemarketing company and as a [[busboy]] before starting a career in comedy.{{cite news|last=Wagner|first=Curt|url=http://articles.redeyechicago.com/2013-01-07/entertainment/36197592_1_lou-malnati-deep-dish-ike-barinholtz/2|title=Ike Barinholtz finds time for laughs in 'The Mindy Project'|date=2013-01-07|publisher=redeyechicago.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} Barinholtz also attended [[Boston University]] and after dropping out, he worked for the [[Chicago Transit Authority]] before starting his comedy career. In a 2013 interview, he said he dropped out of school because he hated it and was doing poorly. In a 2012 phone interview, Barinholtz said he was inspired to pursue a career in comedy after attending a comedy show at [[The Vic Theatre]] and seeing several other comedians. Afterwards, he started taking comedy classes at [[The Second City]], [[ImprovOlympic]] and [[Annoyance Theatre]], and was not successful at first, but chose to stick with it. His younger brother Jon Barinholtz is also an actor and comedian. ==Career== Barinholtz spent two years in [[Amsterdam]] with the famed comedy troupe [[Boom Chicago]], along with [[Jordan Peele]], [[Josh Meyers (actor)|Josh Meyers]] and [[Nicole Parker]]. Barinholtz hosted the 'Worst of Boom Night' during a 10-year anniversary of the improv troupe Boom Chicago, where they performed their worst material from previous shows. He has appeared in the films ''The Adventures of Big Handsome Guy and His Little Friend'' (2005), ''Love, Fear and Rabbits'' (2005) and ''Down'' (2001). Barinholtz currently lives in Los Angeles. Barinholtz is a founding member of The Lindbergh Babies, an improv group directed by [[Del Close]], who worked with [[John Belushi]], [[Bill Murray]], [[Mike Myers (actor)|Mike Myers]] and [[Chris Farley]]. In 2012, Barinholtz joined the cast of the third season of the [[HBO]] series ''[[Eastbound & Down]]'', playing the role of Ivan Dochenko, Kenny Powers' Russian rival. He starred alongside [[Seth Rogen]] in the 2014 comedy ''[[Neighbors (2014 film)|Neighbors]]'', as well as its 2016 [[Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising|sequel]]. Also in 2016, Barinholtz played prison guard Griggs in the [[DC Comics]] film ''[[Suicide Squad (film)|Suicide Squad]]''. Barinholtz appeared in a regular role as nurse Morgan Tookers on the [[Hulu]] comedy series ''[[The Mindy Project]]''. He was also a writer and story editor on the series. He also has a role in ''[[Friends from College]]'', a [[Netflix]] original. ===''MADtv''=== Barinholtz officially joined the cast of ''[[MADtv]]'' in 2002 as a feature performer for the eighth season. He was later promoted to a repertory performer status the following season. Barinholtz would often pair up with fellow cast member [[Josh Meyers (actor)|Josh Meyers]] in various sketches for the eighth and ninth seasons similar to the [[Mike Myers (actor)|Mike Myers]]/[[Dana Carvey]] and [[Jimmy Fallon]]/[[Horatio Sanz]] duos on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''. Barinholtz also paired up with fellow cast member [[Bobby Lee]] in some of his sketches in the later seasons. Some of his famous characters included [[Abercrombie & Fitch]] model Dutch and Principal Lankenstein from the Coach Hines sketches. Barinholtz performs celebrity impressions, including [[Alex Trebek]], [[Andy Dick]], [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], [[Ashton Kutcher]], [[Bo Bice]], [[Dane Cook]], [[Felicity Huffman]], [[Fidel Castro]], [[Howard Dean]], [[Howie Long]], [[Kevin Federline]], [[Mark Wahlberg]], [[Matt Damon]], [[Nick Lachey]], [[Nick Nolte]], [[Pat Sajak]], and [[Ralph Nader]]. In 2007, he decided not to renew his contract for the 13th season of ''MADtv''. His contract, like most other ''MADtv'' cast members, was for five seasons which was up for renewal at the conclusion of the show's 12th season. Barinholtz has commented that he started getting "restless" and did not see eye to eye with some of the ''MADtv'' bosses about how decisions were being made. In 2009, he performed at the [[List of improvisational theater festivals|Chicago Improv Festival]] alongside former ''MADtv'' cast member [[Jordan Peele]].{{cite news|last=Jones|first=Chris|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2009-02-18/entertainment/0902170225_1_headliners-chicago-improv-festival-cuts|title=Chicago Improv Festival announces headliners, cuts prices|date=2009-02-18|publisher=chicagotribune.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} In 2012, Barinholtz performed at another Chicago Improv Festival event with his brother, Jon.{{cite news|last=Wagner|first=Curt|url=http://articles.redeyechicago.com/2012-03-25/entertainment/31237516_1_chicago-improv-festival-jordan-peele-keegan-michael-key|title=Chicago Improv Festival to honor Key and Peele|date=2012-03-25|publisher=redeyechicago.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} He has frequently worked with comedian Dave Stassen, with whom he also went to high school. They co-wrote a SPIKE pilot in which Barinholtz also starred, ''Mega Winner'',{{cite news|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/eastbound-down-mad-tv-alum-230408|title=Eastbound & Down': 'Mad TV' Alum Takes the Mound (Exclusive)|date=2011-09-01|publisher=hollywoodreporter.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} and the 2016 film ''[[Central Intelligence]]''.{{cite news|last=Lussier|first=Germain|url=http://collider.com/galaxy-quest-director-dean-parisot-to-helm-helms-comedy-central-intelligence/|title=GALAXY QUEST Director Dean Parisot to Helm Helms Comedy CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE|date=2010-02-25|publisher=collider.com|accessdate=2013-02-10}} ===Characters=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Character ! Sketch ! Notes |- | Adam Bice || ''[[QVC]]: Quacker Factory'' || |- | Eli || ''The B.S.'' || |- | Astroman || || |- | Duncan Kruskal || ''The Silver Fox'' || |- | Dutch || ''[[Abercrombie & Fitch]]'' || |- | Jeffrey "Jeff" DeShazer || ''Coach Hines'' || |- | oops || '' Knobs '' || |- | Mitchel "Mitch" Ruffin || || |- | Principal Lankenstein || ''Coach Hines'' || He is the principal of St. Francis High and Coach Hines' nemesis. |- | Roy Schenk || ''Feuding Parents'' || |- | Steven "Steve" Wellington || || |} ===''The Mindy Project''=== In 2012, Barinholtz began working as a writer on ''[[The Mindy Project]]'' and was cast as Nurse Morgan Tookers. ==Personal life== Barinholtz is married to Erica Hanson, with whom he has three daughters.{{cite web|last=Harp |first=Justin |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/celebrity/news/a490742/ike-barinholtz-wife-erica-hanson-welcome-daughter.html |title=Ike Barinholtz, wife Erica Hanson welcome daughter |website=Digitalspy.com |date=2013-06-17 |accessdate=2015-12-16}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FwIBoO_kgLE |title=Mindy Kaling on The Talk |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2015-12-16}} Ike’s brother is fellow actor/comedian Jon Barinholtz. Barinholtz was shooting his film ''[[Blockers (film)|Blockers]]'' when he suffered an accident during a fall stunt. The accident left him with two fractured cervical vertebrae in his neck. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Title !! Role !! Novak]], David Stassen, and [[Matt Warburton]] |''The Mindy Project'' |{{nom}} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|54697|Ike Barinholtz}} *{{AllMovie name|406730}} *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060305061102/http://www.madtv.com/ Official MADtv site] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Barinholtz, Ike}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Male actors from Chicago]] [[Category:Jewish American comedians]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American impressionists (entertainers)]] [[Category:American male screenwriters]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American television writers]] [[Category:Jewish American male actors]] [[Category:Jewish American writers]] [[Category:Jewish male comedians]] [[Category:Latin School of Chicago alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:American sketch comedians]] [[Category:Male television writers]] [[Category:Comedians from Illinois]]
